intro: Ratonia falcata, commonly known as the narrowleaf ratonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, producing a distinctive yellowish or greenish hue. Ratonia falcata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
